009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.lang.reflect.Field;
014import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * Interface to be implemented by local 'Parameters' classes. This is part of
024 * the 'simple parameter object' scheme, working with public fields. Only
025 * non-static, non-final, public fields are accepted as parameters.
026 * Current features include: 
027 * <br>
028 * (a) Makes parameter bundles printable by listing all eligible fields.
029 * <br>
030 * (b) Parameter bundles can be added/modified as a whole by ImageJ's
031 * {@link GenericDialog}, supported by specific annotations (use methods
032 * {@link DialogUtils#addToDialog(ParameterBundle, GenericDialog)} and
033 * {@link DialogUtils#getFromDialog(ParameterBundle, GenericDialog)}).
034 * <br>
035 * See the example in {@code DemoParameters} below. Other functionality may be
036 * added in the future.
037 * </p>
038 * <pre>
039 * // Sample parameter bundle:
040 * 
041 * enum MyEnum { A, B, Cee };
042 * 
043 * static class DemoParameters implements ParameterBundle {
044 *      public static int staticInt = 44; // currently static members are listed too!
045 * 
046 *      &#64;DialogLabel("Make a decision:")
047 *      public boolean someBool = true;
048 *      public int someInt = 39;
049 *      public float someFloat = 1.99f;
050 * 
051 *      &#64;DialogLabel("Math.PI")
052 *      &#64;DialogDigits(10)
053 *      public double someDouble = Math.PI;
054 *      public String someString = "SHOW ME";
055 * 
056 *      &#64;DialogHide
057 *      public String hiddenString = "HIDE ME";
058 *      public MyEnum someEnum = MyEnum.B;
059 * }
060 * 
061 * public static void main(String[] args) {
062 *      ParameterBundle params = new DemoParameters();
063 *      System.out.println("p1 = \n" + params.printToString());
064 * 
065 *      GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(ParameterBundle.class.getSimpleName());
066 *      gd.addNumericField("some single int", 123, 0);
067 *      params.addToDialog(gd);
068 * 
069 *      gd.showDialog();
070 *      if (gd.wasCanceled())
071 *              return;
072 * 
073 *      int singleInt = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
074 *      boolean success = params.getFromDialog(gd);
075 *      System.out.println("success = " + success);
076 *      System.out.println("p2 = \n" + params.printToString());
077 * }
078 * </pre>
079 * 
080 * @author WB
081 * @version 2022/02/02
082 * @version 2022/09/14 moved annotations and methods for {@link GenericDialog} to {@link DialogUtils}
083 * 
084 * @see DialogUtils.DialogDigits
085 * @see DialogUtils.DialogLabel
086 * @see DialogUtils.DialogHide
087 */
088public interface ParameterBundle {
089        
090        default Field[] getValidParameterFields() {
091                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
092                List<Field> validFields = new ArrayList<>();
093                for (Field f : clazz.getFields()) {
094                        if (isValidParameterItem(f)) {
095                                validFields.add(f);
096                        }
097                }
098                return validFields.toArray(new Field[0]);
099        }
100        
101        default String printToString() {
102                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
103                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
104                        printToStream(strm);
105                }
106                return bas.toString();
107        }
108
109        default void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
110                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
111                if (!Modifier.isPublic(clazz.getModifiers())) {
112                        strm.print("[WARNING] class " + clazz.getSimpleName() + " should be declared public or protected!\n");
113                }
114                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
115//              strm.println(clazz.getCanonicalName());
116                for (Field field : fields) {
117//                      if (!isValidParameterItem(field)) {
118//                              continue;
119//                      }
120                        strm.print(field.getType().getSimpleName() + " ");
121                        strm.print(field.getName() + " = ");
122                        try {
123                                strm.print(field.get(this).toString());
124                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
125                                strm.print("FIELD VALUE UNREADABLE!");
126                        }       
127                        strm.println();
128//                      int modifiers = field.getModifiers();
129//                      strm.println("Field is public = " + Modifier.isPublic(modifiers));
130//                      strm.println("Field is final = " + Modifier.isFinal(modifiers));
131                }
132        }
133        
134        /**
135         * Validates the correctness and compatibility of the
136         * parameters in this bundle. 
137         * Implementing classes should override this method.
138         * 
139         * @return true if all parameters are OK, false otherwise
140         */
141        default boolean validate() {
142                return true;
143        }
144        
145        static boolean isValidParameterItem(Field f) {
146                int mod = f.getModifiers();
147                if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
148                        return false;
149                }
150                else {
151                        return true;
152                }
153//              Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
154//              if (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == long.class || clazz == float.class || clazz == double.class || 
155//                      clazz == String.class || clazz.isEnum())
156//                      return true;
157//              else
158//                      return false;
159        }
160
161//      static void printModifiers(Field f) {
162//              int mod = f.getModifiers();
163//              System.out.println("Modifiers of field " + f.getName());
164//              System.out.println("abstract     = " + Modifier.isAbstract(mod));
165//              System.out.println("final        = " + Modifier.isFinal(mod));
166//              System.out.println("interface    = " + Modifier.isInterface(mod));
167//              System.out.println("native       = " + Modifier.isNative(mod));
168//              System.out.println("private      = " + Modifier.isPrivate(mod));
169//              System.out.println("protected    = " + Modifier.isProtected(mod));
170//              System.out.println("public       = " + Modifier.isPublic(mod));
171//              System.out.println("static       = " + Modifier.isStatic(mod));
172//              System.out.println("strict       = " + Modifier.isStrict(mod));
173//              System.out.println("synchronized = " + Modifier.isSynchronized(mod));
174//              System.out.println("transient    = " + Modifier.isTransient(mod));
175//              System.out.println("volatite     = " + Modifier.isVolatile(mod));
176//      }
177
178        
179        /**
180         * Returns a shallow copy of the specified {@link ParameterBundle}
181         * instance.
182         * 
183         * @param <T> generic type
184         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
185         * @return a copy with the same type, fields and values as the original instance
186         */
187        public static <T extends ParameterBundle> T duplicate(T params) {
188            return ObjectUtils.copy(params);
189        }
190
